version_description: Fixed a lot of little navigation and problem solving details.

New: ability to preview entire Explorations in addition to individual chapters. 
Fixed: numerous bugs, including a nasty one that prevented some multiple choice options from being rendered legibly.
A few minor bugfixes.
Tap on images to pan and zoom like it's 2008! Plus a lot of smaller improvements and bug fixes.
Bug fixes of the subtle sort and an enhancement which, if you notice, means we messed something up.

It used to be called Brilliant Squared, now it is called Brilliant Premium -- it is still the best value on the App Store.

Also, v1.9.4 makes zooming images a better and squashes a few bugs that we found over the last week or two.
Bug fixes and some changes to solution discussions.
While not the most exciting message, it is true: this version has bug fixes and performance improvements.
This version introduces significantly improved networking to make almost everything in the app faster. It also brings mini-introductions to each exploration and a bunch of another improvements.
Fixed a crashing bug that some of you ran in to, according to our logs. Sorry about that!
Bug fixes and coupons!
Bug fixes

Problems of the day has been replaced with... Problems of the Week! Enjoy three carefully selected sets of five problems across the disciplines that are the same for everyone on Brilliant. Read and post novel solutions with tens of thousands of others around the world.

In addition, please also enjoy many bug fixes.
As the version number implies, this fixes a number of bugs in v1.10.0. We hope you enjoy!
This release brings a ton of behind the scenes improvements. You should be able to use Brilliant on slower and flakier internet connections and everything should feel a bit faster. Please enjoy!
Fixes a number of smaller bugs with offline mode and caching, which many of you use without knowing it ;).
Sometimes, it is as simple as "bug fixes and performance improvements".
Bug fixes related to Google login.

New: the app is better organized and has a new Featured section with links to our learning principles and more.

 Have fun and feel free to send feedback to ios@brilliant.org – we read it all!

Fixed a few bugs we had in in 2.0 release.


What was in v2.0?
New: the app is better organized and has a new Featured section with links to our learning principles and more!

Have fun and feel free to send feedback to ios@brilliant.org – we read it all!
In v2.0.2 – less bugs and smoother scrolling.
Several bug fixes (especially related to opening external links in the app) and performance improvements.

Took care of a few bugs here and there:

- Fixed text and images being cutoff on some devices
- Fixed multiple choice question answers being too small on iPad
- Fixed email links not opening up in the app as expected

* Purpose-made iPad UI for drilling down into courses and topics, and more beautiful layout of problems and quizzes.

* 8 new courses for students, hobbyists, and professionals:
** Machine Learning - Humans are amazing at finding patterns – but what happens when there are hundreds of different variables to keep track of? Machine learning swoops in where humans fail. 
** Gravitational Physics - Here we lay out Newton's law of gravity and crack open the universe of consequences that spring from it. On the journey we'll come to understand planetary phenomena likes tides and atmospheres, the rich geometry of heavenly bodies and their motion, and the engineering considerations of space travel.

And 6 more: Logic, Calculus Done Right, Number Theory, Classical Mechanics, CS Fundamentals, CS Algorithms

- Fixed a crash when selecting a week on the Problems of the Week tab
- Fixed a crash when attempting to share a problem on iPad
- Other minor improvements and bug fixes
Fixes a crash on devices running iOS 9.

Dynamic Type support for problem and solution content – now you should be able to see everything a little big more clearly. Also fixes a number of bugs especially the nasty one related to resetting your password. Happy problem solving!
Several minor bug fixes and improvements.

Fixes a number of bugs:

- Fixed an issue where failed quizzes sometimes looked like they were cleared successfully.
- Navigation in the "Courses" tab will now be saved and restored when relaunching the app.
- Problems of the Week now have a dedicated section in the Stats tab.
- Several other minor bug fixes and enhancements, including improved handling of password reset emails.
Fixes a number of pesky bugs. Also, you can share wiki pages now!
- Fix for quizzes sometimes not completing properly.

- Fixed (a new) issue where quizzes were not completing successfully.
- Fixed code blocks on interstitial panes.
- Several more minor bugfixes.

- Make quiz progress bar tappable to navigate quizzes
- Improve diagnostics of memory-related crashes
- Several other minor improvements and bug fixes
Several minor improvements and bug fixes

- Fixed potential crashes when downloading courses for offline usage
- Memory usage improvements (more coming!)
- Fixed a minor bug related to Daily Problems reminders

3.4.1: Several offline fixes
---
New: you can take courses offline! Our most requested feature.
This one was a little complex, so please drop us a line at ios@brilliant.org if you run into any problems.

- Fix issue preventing some of the community problems from working properly.
- Fix occasional crash when browsing web content within the app.
- Minor tweaks to the visual aspect of problems/quizzes
-Improvements here and there

Here it is after months of work – Brilliant iOS v3.0! The highlights:

- Interface: Brand-new UI paradigm for courses and practice, provides you context for where you are in the app, no matter what you're looking at. Everything in the app feels like it belongs together.
- Navigation: "Recommended" and "Recent" sections on the Courses tab, plus chapters to finish from the home tab.
- Performance: Overhauled problem rendering system, so problems load ~3x as fast.

Plus: > 30 bug fixes.

v3.0.2: some fixes for bugs and rough edges from the v3.0 release.

----

Plus: > 30 bug fixes.

v3.0.3:
- Fixed a crash that affected iPads in split-screen mode.
- Fixed a crash that affected iPhone Plus running iOS 10.
- Fixed an issue with the Topics tab sometimes redirecting to the Course tab when tapped.
- Other various fixes and improvements

Here it is after months of work – Brilliant iOS v3.0! The highlights:
- Interface: Brand-new UI paradigm for courses and practice, provides you context for where you are in the app, no matter what you're looking at. Everything in the app feels like it belongs together.
- Navigation: "Recommended" and "Recent" sections on the Courses tab, plus chapters to finish from the home tab.
- Performance: Overhauled problem rendering system, so problems load ~3x as fast.

Plus: > 30 bug fixes.

New: 
- Enjoy lovely, custom cinematic intros to each chapter to to give you a sense of what you'll learn by the end of the chapter.
- View all the quizzes in a chapter in a beautiful gallery and track your progress through the chapter and course.

Bugs:
- Fixed a lot of them ;)

--- What's Brilliant for iOS 3.0? ---

After months of work, we're proud to give you Brilliant for iOS 3.0! Here are the highlights:

- Interface: Brand-new UI paradigm for courses and practice, provides you context for where you are in the app, no matter what you're looking at. Everything in the app feels like it belongs together.
- Navigation: "Recommended" and "Recent" sections on the Courses tab, plus chapters to finish from the home tab.
- Performance: Overhauled problem rendering system, so problems load ~3x as fast.

New: initial support for ClassKit and assigning work through the Schoolwork.app system. Bring Brilliant into your classrooms and study groups with ease!

Fixed: a lot of little bugs.
Fixes some issues with the app preview video.

New! Daily Problems – Stay sharp in math and science through fun, bite-sized learning. 

Two new problems from with beautiful explanations every day. We think you'll like them a lot.

v3.3.1: Touched up some bugs and design tweaks.

Two new problems with beautiful explanations every day. We think you'll like them a lot.

Brilliant v4.0 brings an entirely new vibe to your favorite app for seeing math and science in a new way.

Version 4 brings two big changes: an overhauled course view to track your progress more easily (thanks for all the feedback!) and a far more consistent and simple way to download courses for offline use.

We hope you enjoy it!

Brilliant v5.0 adds support for an entirely new course experience. 

More interactive, more practice, fast navigation, hints, and step-by-step solutions. Check out Algorithm Fundamentals and Math Fundamentals for a peek – and please tell us what you think at ios@brilliant.org.
- Improved lesson loading speed
- Fix an issue affecting offline mode and downloaded courses
- Fix for "Start Course" button being broken in some courses.
- Minor bug fixes

Fixes issue with Premium subscriptions.

If you had any issues with your purchase recently, please email support@brilliant.org.
